title: Formula One testing hit by snow
text: February 28, 2018 / 10:17 AM / Updated 7 hours ago Formula One testing hit by snow Reuters Staff 1 Min Read BARCELONA (Reuters) - Snow hit the third day of Formula One’s pre-season testing on Wednesday, with no cars on track for the first two hours while the medical helicopter remained grounded in near-freezing temperatures. “You don’t learn anything. We will never race in this circumstance, and the only thing you do is risk the car,” commented Haas team principal Guenther Steiner. Slideshow (5 Images) “This being the first test of the season, we are lean on spares, and we cannot risk it. And at the moment it does not look much better on Thursday. It is getting warmer but still wet.” The first of two pre-season tests is due to end on Thursday, with the second at the Circuit de Catalunya next week. The season starts in Australia on March 25. Teams have discussed adding a day on to the second test but have yet to decide. “I am positive that next week will be better -- no rain, temperatures up to normal. And then you can do some work,” Steiner told reporters. Reporting by Alan Baldwin; Editing by John O'Brien
